data.name: PD_ExportActions_filter
data.value: If ticked, this export action only ever exports items included in the filtering currently applied to the applicable List View (only supports filters supplied by a currently connected FilterZen Filter Web Part).

data.name: PC_ExportActions_nf
data.value: Exclude the header row with column names

data.name: Tool_ExportActions_Desc
data.value: Use this tool to define your ExportZen List data exports. Each export action specifies which columns to export and lets you customize various export-related options.

data.name: Old_NoFilterZenEnt
data.value: A FilterZen Basic license is required for the 'Respect Currently Applied Filters' feature.

data.name: PC_ExportActions_show
data.value: Show ExportZen menu item in the following Lists

data.name: PC_ExportActions_notb
data.value: Ignore quick-filter tabs in PeopleZen exports

data.name: LocaleUser
data.value: User account locale ('My Settings / My Regional Settings')

data.name: _Copyright
data.value: Copyright © 2008-2011 ROXORITY Ltd. All rights reserved.

data.name: CfgSettingChoice_HideAction_auto
data.value: Only if CSV export actions exist (requires activated Site Collection feature)

data.name: PC_ExportActions_vhcol
data.value: Export all item version history in separate column

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_MultiSep
data.value: Separator for exported multi-valued Column data

data.name: PD_ExportActions_vhcol
data.value:
Optional: if you'd like ExportZen to append an additional column recording all version history per item (only for the Columns specified above, in a simple plain-text format), specify your preferred name for this CSV column here. Leave blank to not append a version history column.

Not applicable to User Profile exports via PeopleZen.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_title
data.value: Specify the caption for this CSV export action to be shown in the export menu item for the Lists specified above. (If you do not specify a caption, the above name for this export action will be used, or if blank, its internal ID.)

data.name: PD_ExportActions_sep_c
data.value: recommended default separator for most CSV-consuming apps

data.name: PD_ExportActions_sep_s
data.value: alternative CSV format required by some international Excel versions

data.name: PD_ExportActions_sep_t
data.value: some CSV-consuming apps actually require TSV (tab-separated values)

data.name: PD_ExportActions_excel
data.value: Not recommended unless you and your users intend to only ever open these CSV exports in Microsoft Office Excel AND Excel displays all comma-separated column values in a single cell (some internationalized Excel versions do that, some don't).

data.name: Old_NoExportList
data.value: The List specified in the 'exportlist' URL parameter could not be found.

data.name: LocaleBrowser
data.value: User agent (browser) locale (potentially unreliable / inconsistent settings!)

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_HideAction
data.value: Hide (2007) or disable (2010) SharePoint's out-of-box "Export to Excel" command

data.name: HelpTopic_intro
data.value: CSV Data Exports for SharePoint Lists

data.name: LocaleWeb
data.value: Web site locale ('Site Settings / Regional Settings') -- [ {0} ]

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_MultiSep
data.value: This specifies the text used to combine the export value representations of List Columns containing multiple values, such as multi-Choice and multi-Lookup Columns.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_nf
data.value: By default, ExportZen exports always begin with a header row denoting all column names. Tick this check-box option to skip this header row in your exports and instead only include raw data records.

data.name: Old_NoRuleItem
data.value: The specified CSV Export Action Definition '{0}' could not be found ({1} actions scanned) --- fully refresh the previous page, and/or review your ExportZen action definitions under Site Settings / ExportZen Studio / Export Actions. User: {2}, lang: [{3}].

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_HideAction
data.value: By default, your ExportZen action commands co-exist together with the built-in, out-of-box 'Export to Excel' command. If you intend to fully replace that functionality with ExportZen, you can set whether and when to show (2007) / enable (2010) the built-in, out-of-box 'Export to Excel' command (affects both both the SharePoint 2007 List Actions tool-bar menu item and the ribbon button in the SharePoint 2010 'Connect and Export' section of the List Tools ribbon tab).

data.name: PC_ExportActions_vhrows
data.value: Export item version history in separate rows, one per version

data.name: PD_ExportActions_view
data.value:
If ticked, this export action only ever exports items included in the currently displayed List View, applying the View-defined default sort orders and filters (but not currently user-applied live sort order, filters or paging); otherwise, all List items are exported, unfiltered and in their original sort order.

Not applicable to User Profile exports via PeopleZen.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_unix
data.value: If un-ticked, ExportZen generates CSV data files using escaping patterns (for critical characters such as commas, line-breaks and quotes) that software written for Windows or Office is more likely to read flawlessly. Tick this check box to generate CSV data files using UNIX-style escaping patterns instead (only recommended if you get errors while feeding your exported CSV data files to other, non-Office software).

data.name: PD_ExportActions_show
data.value: Select in which Lists this export action will be offered as a menu item to end users (in the SharePoint 2007 "Actions" toolbar menu and in the SharePoint 2010 "Connect and Export" ribbon group (both only if the "ExportZen List Integration" Site Collection feature is activated too and for List Views, only with their Toolbar Type property set to Full or Show, not Summary or None).

data.name: PD_ExportActions_nopg
data.value: Even if the PeopleZen Web Part to be exported is paged, if this check-box option is ticked then all user profiles belonging to the Web Part are exported, instead of just those included in the currently shown page.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_notb
data.value: Even if the PeopleZen Web Part to be exported is tabbed, if this check-box option is ticked then all user profiles belonging to the Web Part are exported, instead of just those included in the currently shown tab.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_desc
data.value: Specify the description for this CSV export action to be shown in the export menu item for the Lists specified above.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_cols
data.value:
Specify the List Columns (one per line) to include in that order in output CSV data files generated by this export action. (To rename a Column in the exported CSV, enter the List Column name, followed by a colon (:) and the CSV column name.) Be sure those Columns will be available in the exported List, otherwise the CSV column will remain empty.

If you clear this setting and keep it blank, the export will include all available View Columns shown.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_vhrows
data.value:
Instead of keeping all version history in a single column, you can export each version in the history to its own row. These versions will appear underneath the data item row, in descending sort order, and in this case you'll need a separate CSV column to denote the version number of each history record. You need to enter this CSV column name (for example 'Version') above this check-box option if ticked.

Not applicable to User Profile exports via PeopleZen.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_sep
data.value: Change to semicolon if your users intend to only ever open these CSV exports in Microsoft Office Excel AND their Excel version displays all comma-separated column values in a single cell (some internationalized Excel versions do that, some don't).

data.name: PD_ExportActions_loc
data.value: This setting controls how numbers and dates are represented in this export. For example, dates may be stored in an US format (due to your SharePoint installation) but your export consumers may use a different-locale version of Excel (such as for example German), which would then mis-read and mis-represent factually-correct, but US-formatted date values. Keep the default choice to start with and experiment as needed if results do not meet expectations.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_bom
data.value: ONLY tick this option if you selected the UTF-8 encoding above AND your exported contents are not decoded correctly by the external software that needs to consume this export in production. Recommended for opening UTF-8 exports in Excel.

data.name: PD_ExportActions_enc
data.value: Only if your exports contain international characters that don't look as expected in external software importing this export should you start experimenting with different export encodings. The Unicode / UTF encodings are the recommended choices to test before trying other encodings. Keep this set to Default UNLESS your exported contents are not decoded correctly by external software that needs to consume this export in production.
